sentences.sContent: But no one knew where the sulfur came from.
sentences.sContent_eng: But no one knew where the sulfur came from.
sentences.sCn: 但是，没有人知道硫来自何处。

sentences.sContent: Well, this chlorine has taken one electron from the sulfur.
sentences.sContent_eng: Well, this chlorine has taken one electron from the sulfur.
sentences.sCn: 对了，这个氯从硫那里得到了一个电子。

sentences.sContent: These pollutants are called aerosols and they include soot as well as compounds of nitrogen and sulfur and other stuff into the air.
sentences.sContent_eng: These pollutants are called aerosols and they include soot as well as compounds of nitrogen and sulfur and other stuff into the air.
sentences.sCn: 通常，我们称这些污染物为悬浮微粒，它们包含烟尘以及氮硫与进入大气的其他物质的混合物。

remMethod.val: 吸入过多的硫(sulfur)让人十分痛苦(suffer)

words.tran: 硫磺的；含多量硫磺的；含（六价）硫的
使成硫酸盐；用硫酸处理；使在上形成硫酸铅沉淀
